page.title: 02WALSDEN Geography
page.content: {Walsden}is in{Todmorden's}southern valley leading towards{Rochdale.}It is a quiet{Yorkshire}village with a{ {Lancashire}postal address. The main part of the village lies in the valley bottom and is surrounded by hills and moorland. The valley bottom rises from 480 ft. to 600 ft. above sea level, in about two and a half miles. The western side rises steeply to an extensive plateau at between 800 and 1000 ft. and then up to nearly 1500 ft. The eastern side has a more even slope to moorland at 900 ft. rising to 1200 ft. The stream in the valley bottom is called the{Calder}by the locals but is {Walsden Water}on the maps. Also running along the valley bottom is the railway, the A6033 and a disused canal.
